qas.question: In what part of the country can most of the Congo's citizens be found?
How long is the track connecting Brazzaville and Pointe-Noire?
What percent of the population of the Congo lives outside urban areas?
What is one of the small cities in the Congo?
How long is the road that connects the largest cities?
Where has commercial activity increased rapidly?
What are urban economies dependent on the government for?

context: The Republic of the Congo's sparse population is concentrated in the <a0_0>southwest<a0_0/>ern portion of the country, leaving the vast areas of tropical jungle in the north virtually uninhabited. Thus, Congo is one of the most urbanized countries in Africa, with <b2_0>70<b2_0/>% of its total population living in a few urban areas, namely in <b3_0>Brazzaville<b3_0/>, Pointe-Noire or one of the small cities or villages lining the <a1_0><b4_0>534-kilometre (332 mi)<b4_0/><a1_0/> railway which connects the two cities. In <b5_0>rural areas<b5_0/>, industrial and commercial activity has declined rapidly in recent years, leaving rural economies dependent on the government for <b6_0>support and subsistence<b6_0/>.
